commit.message:
Don't provide client certificate for mail updates.
Pick up (optional) client certificate for syncupdates.
Added test for client certificate authentication.

nodes.bodyText: This header doesn't mean very much, as the proxy doesn't check the CA. Do we need to include it?
Fingerprint I think (can it be included in the audit log?)
Also log the offered credential in the audit log here?
Can you use the X509CertificateWrapper class to extract the certificate?

commit.message: Tidy up code, use X509CertificateWrapper for cert operations, added tests, handle Apache's SSL_CLIENT_CERT PEM format.
Added feature toggle for client certificate authentication.
Enable client certificate authentication in tests.

nodes.bodyText: Be careful with this, I think Spring will default to TRUE if it's not explicitly set to FALSE in the external properties file (and what's the order?). Is it safer to remove it?

commit.message: Client cert authentication should not be enabled by default.
Also accept FAILED SSL verify header (for self signed).
